title: Nimbus EL/CL failure, websocket frame size exceeded
body:

### Description
relates to https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/issues/3305

Nimbus should be able to use besu as an execution client and eth1-endpoint.  However, the websocket transport fails consistently.  Debugging the websocket output, it appears either the request or response is exceeding the default max websocket frame size of 64kb:

```
2022-02-03 00:12:02.436+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-12 | DEBUG | WebSocketRequestHandler | WS-RPC request -> eth_getBlockByNumber
2022-02-03 00:12:03.136+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Opened connection from 127.0.0.1:42694. Total of active connections: 2/80
2022-02-03 00:12:03.137+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Websocket Connected (host=127.0.0.1, port=42694)
2022-02-03 00:12:03.145+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Opened connection from 127.0.0.1:42696. Total of active connections: 3/80
2022-02-03 00:12:03.146+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Websocket Connected (host=127.0.0.1, port=42696)
2022-02-03 00:12:03.147+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Received Websocket request {"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_subscribe","params":["newHeads"],"id":1}
 (host=127.0.0.1, port=42696)
2022-02-03 00:12:03.148+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-2 | DEBUG | WebSocketRequestHandler | WS-RPC request -> eth_subscribe
2022-02-03 00:12:03.149+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-2 | DEBUG | SubscriptionManager | Subscribe request SubscribeRequest{subscriptionType=NEW_BLOCK_HEADERS, includeTransaction=false, filterParameter=null, connectionId=__vertx.ws.18bbd1a6-e539-487c-b1f7-8069dd1e826a}
2022-02-03 00:12:13.418+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Unrecoverable error on Websocket: Max frame length of 65536 has been exceeded. (host=127.0.0.1, port=42694)
2022-02-03 00:12:13.421+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Unrecoverable error on Websocket: Connection was closed (host=127.0.0.1, port=42694)
2022-02-03 00:12:13.421+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Websocket Disconnected (host=127.0.0.1, port=42694)
2022-02-03 00:12:13.424+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Connection closed from 127.0.0.1:42694. Total of active connections: 2/80
2022-02-03 00:12:13.425+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-2 | DEBUG | SubscriptionManager | Removing subscription for connectionId __vertx.ws.8068b162-04aa-4c64-8a32-a5d04593659c
```

From the output, it is unclear whether this is a nimbus request (executePayload) or besu response (blockByNumber) frame size problem.  Further investigation is necessary.  

### Acceptance Criteria
* Besu should handle consensus clients payloads correctly
* if necessary, expose max frame size for websocket connections as a cli param

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. start besu with kintsugi spec and web socket rpc enabled
2. start nimbus using besu as eth1-endpoint

**Frequency:** 100%

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: besu/merge:latest

### Additional Information

socat output of connection, subscription, failure, disconnect:

[https://app.zenhub.com/files/206414745/c7a2173a-fe16-411e-a94b-3673f7c6948d/download](https://app.zenhub.com/files/206414745/c7a2173a-fe16-411e-a94b-3673f7c6948d/download)

It appears that nimbus is using [news](https://github.com/Tormund/news/) which has a static max frame size set to 1mb.  Bumping besu to 1mb max frame size enables the besu/nimbus el/cl combo to work on kintsugi.
